title: Humpback whales herd fish using spiralling columns of bubbles
text:
It was once thought that humpback whales simply open their mouths and scoop up huge numbers of fish.

But researchers have found the mammals use their blowholes to create spiralling columns of bubbles which herd fish into a smaller area.

Once trapped, the humpbacks can pick off hundreds of creatures in one huge mouthful.

A team of researchers from the University of Hawaii captured this spectacular footage of humpbacks whales using a technique called bubble-net fishing in the waters near Alaska.

Previously the BBC filmed a similar feat, but the feeding behaviour it has never been officially recorded by scientists until now.
